text:
Hey guys,

I use in_play_service.get_scores on soccer match and sometimes i have no data for a football match.

For example :
`event_list = [32425345, 32425347, 32425348, 32425366, 32466972, 32504596, 32504599, 32504600, 32504601, 32504602, 32504603, 32504604, 32504605, 32504607, 32504608, 32504609, 32524091, 32536472]`
`<http://trading.in|trading.in>_play_service.get_scores(event_ids=event_list)` 

I never got any data for match 32504596 which took place yesterday. I have noticed this problem and I have not been able to explain why but it happens quite frequently.

Is it possible that betfair does not offer data for certain matches? This is very strange.

Thanks

elements.text:
Hey guys,

I use in_play_service.get_scores on soccer match and sometimes i have no data for a football match.

For example :
trading.in
_play_service.get_scores(event_ids=event_list)

I never got any data for match 32504596 which took place yesterday. I have noticed this problem and I have not been able to explain why but it happens quite frequently.

Is it possible that betfair does not offer data for certain matches? This is very strange.

Thanks

text: Correct, not every match has data. Why is it strange?

elements.text: Correct, not every match has data. Why is it strange?

text: Here's an easy to find example: <https://www.betfair.com/exchange/plus/en/football/friendly-matches/cd-illescas-v-valencia-mestalla-betting-32549159>. As you can see there's no score displayed on the website. The inplayservice is an undocumented endpoint used by the website. You shouldn't have any expectations with respect coverage, availability, timeliness, correctness or anything else

text:
quick question please..re `max_selection_exposure=30`,
Given this scenario: two horse race, both horses laid at 1.8 for £1.
Does it calculate the exposure on each selection taking into account the bets on the the other selections?
Ie would it be calculated in flumine as an exposure on each at - 0.80p or a +0.20 on each?
I'm sure its the latter but wanted to check. Would anyone know please? Thanks

Edit ; Its the former.

elements.text: quick question please..re
max_selection_exposure=30

,
Given this scenario: two horse race, both horses laid at 1.8 for £1.
Does it calculate the exposure on each selection taking into account the bets on the the other selections?
Ie would it be calculated in flumine as an exposure on each at - 0.80p or a +0.20 on each?
I'm sure its the latter but wanted to check. Would anyone know please? Thanks

Edit ; Its the former.

text:
I am being facetious. Runningball IS an excellent source of football data but it’s also very expensive. You get what you pay for innit?

I doubt you will find anything better than the inplayservice that is free. It seems to me like you’re being overly precious about the coverage. In my experience the vast majority of matches have inplayservice data 

As for mapping external sources to Betfair, this is a lot of work and again I doubt anyone is just going to give it to you for feee

Anyway, I'll try to get the job done without that information.

Thanks for your time.

text: I have been trying to  arrange my files created from market recorder but struggling a bit rn. Let's say I want to create a folder wrt event_Id_type. I tried changing the process_raw_data function : directory = os.path.join(self.local_dir,str(data.get('marketDefinition').get('eventTypeId')),market_id). So this line ensures that my data is saved in the correct location. But the location is created in the add function first and there's no 'data' argument passed to it so I can't find eventTypeId there. What solution are you guys using here?

I'm thinking of adding another level to separate by market_type, so it is easier/faster to backtest strategies only in a specific market_type (until now I had a condition in the check_market_book).

text:
how do I calculate correct stakes for equal profit when I am placing bets across two different exchanges

e.g.

Back Over 2.5 £10 @ 1.79 on Smarkets (2% commission)
Lay Over 2.5 £x @ 1.6 on Betfair (5% commission)

(just an example scanario to plug in to a formula)

elements.text:

(just an example scanario to plug in to a formula)

text:
I got my robot friend to do this, verify that this is correct:

```S_back = 10  # Stake on Smarkets
O_back = 1.79  # Odds on Smarkets
C_back = 0.02  # Commission on Smarkets
O_lay = 1.6  # Odds on Betfair
C_lay = 0.05  # Commission on Betfair

# Calculating the lay stake on Betfair for equal profit
S_lay = (S_back * (O_back - 1) * (1 - C_back)) / (1 - C_lay)
8.149```

elements.text: I got my robot friend to do this, verify that this is correct:

S_back = 10  # Stake on Smarkets
O_back = 1.79  # Odds on Smarkets
C_back = 0.02  # Commission on Smarkets
O_lay = 1.6  # Odds on Betfair
C_lay = 0.05  # Commission on Betfair

# Calculating the lay stake on Betfair for equal profit
S_lay = (S_back * (O_back - 1) * (1 - C_back)) / (1 - C_lay)
8.149

text: Hey! Today in one of the races the lay side was over 102% so I traded all the horse from the lay side & got +EV on each horse after some time 2 horses were declared non-runner & my EV dropped to -ve. Any clue why this happened & if there’s a way to determine this before betting. Thing is I did this 3-4 times today but still market makers were quoting the lay side above 100% so I was wondering if they had some information based on which they priced it correctly?
